resources.string: Unfortunately, we are unable to find you in our system. Please check your email address and company VAT number.
Use this email to sign in or request access to the administrator.
It is currently not possible to select more than 20 locations at once.
Mandatory login with pin, fingerprint or face identification
Place the card by the contactless area displayed on the terminal. When successful a green LED light will be shown.
Insert the card in the bottom of the terminal socket. The card can only be read when the chip is facing upwards.
Swipe the card downwards with a quick move on the right side of the terminal. The card stripe should face the terminal.
From either the menu or the payment display, navigate to the History
Insert the amount that needs to be refunded and press the checkmark
Handover the terminal to the customer and let them type the tip amount they would like. Then press the checkmark.
On the top of your terminal, a small lid can be lifted where the contactless icon is displayed. Lift it up so it opens, with two fingers.
Flip up the lit and pull
In some cases a PIN code is required after the card interaction with the terminal.
The app can be found on the front page over softkey buttons
The new paper roll should face down so it touches the display. Pull it out a bit, so there’s some excess paper left.
A new receipt will be printed with the refunded amount
This is the app with the cash register icon, which you use to take payments.
Remember that there is a differnce between doing a refund or a reversal.
A reversal can be done directly on the terminal, and a refund needs to be done in the app. \nApproximate handling time is 5 days for a refund.
If I have ALREADY done my end-of-day closure
Remove the old one and replace it with the new one. The new paper roll might have some plastic you have to remove.
If I have NOT done my end-of-day closure yet
You are now ready to use the terminal. To make sure it works smoothly, make a test print or run a diagnose.
A popup occur with 3 options. You can either print a customer receipt or a merchant receipt. Your receipt will now print
You will now see an overview of your transaction history. Choose the transaction you like
All rights reserved to Nexi Group

MyPayments è developed by Nexi Group to support you and your business. Learn more about Nets as a part of Nexi Group https://www.nets.eu/nets-nexi.

With MyPayments you can:
 • Get support setting up your terminal
 • Easily track you card turnover
 • Identify peak operational hours during the week
 • Discover which countries your customer are from
 • Keep an eye on your customers’ loyalty
Get in touch when you need help
Are you sure you want to accept the activation of Tap to Pay on Android on this location?
Improvements to make MyPayments app more accessible.

Here you can view information related to your settlements. You can also view invoices from Nets, if available.

 

Please log into MyNets on my.nets.eu/portal to find more details on your settlement. Finnish users can access their settlement details on the Merchant Portal, merchantreporting.nets.eu/nets

Here you can view information related to your settlements. You can also view invoices from Nexi, if available.

 

Please log on to www.nexi.de to find more details on your settlement.
Here is how you can acquire more licenses for Tap to Pay on iPhone
To acquire more Tap to Pay on Android licenses, please visit the Smart Portal where you can manage and add additional licenses to your outlets.
To acquire more Tap to Pay on iPhone license, \nplease visit the
Your smartphone is unfortunately not compatible with Tap to Pay on Android device and you can therefore not use this feature.
Did you already receive your terminal?
Type in the amount that needs to be refunded and press the GREEN OK button.
Type in the amount of the transaction.
Type in amount and press OK
Try Analytics Pro 30 days for free
Benchmark of your sales performance against the overall performance of companies (based on a median value) within your industry and country.
Comparing the total value of customers who visit only once and those who return (make at least two purchases).
Amount of transactions in price ranges
How cardholders who visited your sales location shopped right before and after their visit.
What is your share of your customers’ total spend within your business category.
Where your customers shopped before and after their visit
Value of your returning and one-time customers
Customer’s visits before and after visiting your location
Estimated origin of your customers based on their card purchase history in grocery stores.
Please go to Nets MyPayments on the web to manage your account.
How your business is performing compared with your sector?

How your customers choose to do business with you \nHere we look at how individual payment cards have appeared in your e-commerce and store channels. Some customers may only choose to purchase online, others only in store, and some prefer using both channels. Note that purchase volume is not considered.

Here we look at cardholders who visited your sales location and search for the category of their previous purchase right before and after the visit. Only transactions recorded four hours before and after the visit are counted. The insight is showing the most typical routes into the sales location. Direct sales indicates that the consumer only took the trip to your sales location without doing purchases elsewhere. You can choose to view all consumers or by their country of origin.

Here we look at cardholders who visited your sales location and search for their total purchases in the same category across all merchants. The insight is showing how much of your customer\'s purchases in your category did they bring to you and what is the potential of additional sales to them should they only do business with you.

Here we estimate the origin of your customers based on their card purchase history in other stores. The district where the most frequent purchases of customers such as their grocery shopping occurs used as the estimate.
Activate to keep using Analytics Pro
Only available when “all sales locations” selected
Your sales compared to similar businesses
Your share of your customers total spend in restaurants

Here we look at the spend of customers visiting only once and those who return (make at least two purchases). This insight shows the spend potential of your returning customers and whether it’s worth attracting more loyal customers.
Only Android phones will work for our Tap To Pay solution
This app version is no longer supported. Please update your app from the App Store.
This app version is no longer supported. Please update your app from the Play Store.
Get notified when we release a new version of the app.

Select the stores, where you would like to activate an automatic tip function, so the customer can add a tip every time they pay. This function will be applied on every applicable terminal in a chosen store.
Lift up the printer cover on top of your terminal. The printer cover is located behind the contactless reader icon.
Remove the old paper roll and replace it with a new one. The new paper roll should face down so it touches the display. Pull it out a bit to make sure there is some excess paper left.
Replace the paper roll with a new one
Rip off the excess paper and perform a test transaction or run a diagnosis to make sure it works smoothly.
Open the Receipt copy app to print the last receipt.
Click the printer icon in the lower right corner on the screen.
The terminal will print copies of your own and your customer’s receipt.
Use the numeric pad to enter the amount of the transaction. Press the GREEN button to confirm.
Let your customer complete the purchase by using their payment card.\nNote that the contactless reader is located behind the receipt printer cover.
Let your customer insert their payment card. You can only receive tips when your customer pays with the chip of the payment card.
Your customer can use the numeric pad to type the tip amount. Press the GREEN button to complete the purchase. \nIn some cases, the terminal will ask for a pincode.
Let your customer add the desired tip amount
Open the app with the pen and paper symbol to do a refund of a payment.
Enter the Manager PIN which is 000000 and press the GREEN button to confirm.
Let your customer complete the refund by using their payment card.\nMind that the contactless reader is located behind the receipt printer cover.
Within 7 seconds click on the RED (X) button if your customer does not need the receipt or tap the printer icon in the lower, right corner if they need it.
Connect the power cable to the power outlet on the back of the terminal.
Press the RED (X) button until the screen turns on. The terminal is ready when the screen with the apps appear.\nThis can take up to 1 min.
If you want to connect to LAN, insert the LAN cable on the back of the terminal.\nIf you rather want to use the WLAN click here to see the guide.
This process takes a few seconds.\nWhen a receipt is printed, the terminal is set up right.
Use the numeric pad to enter a small amount to be able to do a test transaction. Press the GREEN button to confirm.
Complete the test transaction by using your own payment card. \nNote that the contactless reader is located behind the receipt printer cover.
Tap To Pay will be disabled when the battery is too low. Place the phone in a charger to proceed.
Tap To Pay will be disabled when the battery is too low. Put the phone in a charger soon.
Your battery is too low to use Tap to Pay on iPhone, charge your phone
Tap To Pay is disabled because the battery is too low. Put the phone in a charger now.
Please select the terminal you need help with, so we can help you faster
Use your merchant card by using the magnetic stripe.
Let your customer tap/insert their payment card by either using the chip or contactless to complete the refund.
Which card can be used on Tap to Pay on iPhone?
Cards that your customers can use
Cardholder will receive refund to the same card account that was used for the payment
Girocard accepted via Visa/Mastercard co-badge, credit card rates will be charged.
Which cards can be used on Tap To Pay?
Place the card less by the contactless area displayed on the terminal. When successful a green LED light will be shown.
Insert the card in the buttom of the terminal socket. The card can only be read when the chip is facing upwards.
Swipe the card downwards with a quick move on the right side of the terminal. The card stripe should face the terminal.
A list will come of all your transactions. Select the one you want and press on the “Print” icon.
This will take you to the place where you can make a refund for your customer
Insert the full amount including the tip that was added by the customer
On your front screen on the terminal, press on the device menu
In some cases a PIN code is required after the card interaction with the terminal.
Find the original number of the physical receipt
On the top of your terminal, a small lit can be lifted where the contactless icon is displayed. Lift it up so it opens, with two fingers.
Flip up the lit and pull
When the customer is done noting down the tip on the reciept go to your terminal
Go to tipping function in favorites and enter the amount the customer just wrote on the reciept
The new paper roll sould face down so it touch the display. Pull it a bit out, so there’s some excess paper left.
Handover the receipt and a pencil to the customer and let them note the tip amount
The final paper receipt will be printed from the terminal and can be handed over to the customer.

A new receipt will be printed with the refunded amount

Merchant Portal can be accessed here: merchantportal.luottokunta.fi/nets. Please follow the guide for how to log in or create access.
On all screens, you can select up to 20 point of sales at a time and you will get the aggregated data.

The \'My Business\' screen provides details about your company and you can select upto 20 sales location on this screen. You can view the terminal details for the selected sales locations in the section \'Terminals\'. Also, the functionality of selecting sales locations is available on all screens.
On the Concardis portal (www.concardis.com/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your Service Agreement Details including Card type acceptances.

In order to change the name of your company, please contact our service center for support. Go to the ‘Support’ section in your Concardis portal (www.concardis.com/), go to ‘Send us a message’ and select the category ‘Account data’ > ‘Change of company name/ ownership’.
On the Concardis portal (https://portal.nexi.de/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your pricelist.
Yes. Select ‘Edit Dashboard’ and select and/or deselect widgets. Your dashboard will adjust according to your selection.

On the Concardis portal (www.concardis.com/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your Service Agreement details. This page can be printed out directly from your own device.ms_faq_contract_desc
You can share or download the invoices and settlements in PDF format.
Please log in to Merchant Portal on merchantportal.luottokunta.fi/nets to find more details on your settlement.

"The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is an EU regulation (applicable since 25 May 2018) that ensures the protection of the rights and freedom of natural persons in relation to the processing of their personal data, which is a fundamental right in the EU. More specifically, the GDPR regulates, in form of strict rules, the processing (i.e. collection, storing, transfer, deletion etc.) of personal data in all companies operating within the EU.\nPlease visit the public pages of the EU for more information: http://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/reform/index_en.htm."

You may toggle on and off your notification preferences in the \'My Business\' tab for the following: Improvements to the app, Promotional offers, Data update, News from Nets related to your business.

The credit card data for which you have an acquiring agreement with Nets Merchant Services is available in the app. Also the transactions and invoices data for which you have a terminal agreement is available in the app.
MyNets can be accessed here: my.nets.eu/portal
You may toggle on and off notifications in the \'My Business\' tab. Select Notifications from the \'My Business\' tab and then select or de-select \'Allow notifications\'.
Improvements to the FAQs helping you to solve your most common queries.
On all screens, you can see all of the point of sales under the same organisation. You can select upto 20 point of sales at a time.
On the Concardis portal (www.concardis.com/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your contract details.
Please log in to MyNets on my.nets.eu/portal to find more details on your settlement.
The section \'My Business\' > \'About\' > \'Terms and Conditions\' provides you access to the Terms and Conditions. You may also visit our Website www.concardis.com for General Terms and Conditions.
You can see your transaction and settlement data in the app at 16:00 the day after the transactions. The statistics data will be available at 10:00.
How was your experience with the setup of your new terminal?
Thank you, your feedback was submitted
Easy process with payout within two days of application
You are eligible for a cash advance of up to EUR 15,000
Get rewarded when paying off early

If you\'ve recently noticed that you\'re unable to use the Tap To Pay feature on your phone, there may be a simple explanation. This feature will automatically be disabled when your battery level falls below 5%. The purpose of this is to conserve enough battery life and prevent your device from running out of power in the middle of a payment.
MyPayments app is now available in French and Italian languages!
Unlock the potential of future payments with an Android phone
Go to your smart portal to see them
You can already go through our guides to prepare in advance
Press the GREEN OK button.\nIf the amount of the transaction is significantly low, you will be asked to confirm the amount by pressing the GREEN OK button once more.
Press the GREEN OK button once more to choose ‘Function’.
Start out by pressing the GREEN OK button.
Use the arrow buttons to choose either ‘Total amount’ or ‘No’ by\nPressing the GREEN OK button.

Turn the charging base upside down and open the back cover. Insert the power cable into the socket outlet and the other end to a wall socket. Afterwards, refit the back cover to the base station and turn the base station around again.

Is the terminal charging? If not, check if power cable is inserted properly.\nIs the Bluetooth icon green? If not, check if the network cable is connected to the terminal and router or disconnect and connect again.
Press the GREEN OK button and use your own payment card to finish the test transaction.\nWhen successful, a receipt will be printed.
Connect the network cable to the top of the charging base and the other end of the cable to a router.
Open the app with the cash register symbol to be able to receive tips.
Place the payment terminal onto the base station and wait for it to power up. This can take up to 1 minute. If it does not start up, then try to press OK.
Place the payment terminal on top of the charging base and wait for it to power up. This can take up to 1 minute. If it does not start up, then try to\npress OK.
A receipt will be printed.\nAfterwards, press the RED Cancel button to return to the home screen.
A receipt will be printed.\nAfterwards, press the RED Cancel button to return to the home screen.
When the terminal is ready, press the Menu button. A reconciliation shows all the transactions and the total turnover you have had on your terminal.
Press 6 or navigate down to Reconciliation with the arrow buttons.\nWait for the Reconciliation process to complete.
Press 6 or navigate down to Reconciliation with the arrow buttons.\nWait for the Reconciliation process to complete.
Flip the adapter (Magicbox) around and insert the network cable into the ethernet outlet. Connect the other end of the network cable to a router. Wait for the terminal to power up.
Place the terminal on the base station
Press the GREEN OK button, type in a small amount and press the GREEN OK button again.
Press the GREEN OK button and use your own payment card to finish the test transaction.\nWhen successful, a receipt will be printed.
Press the GREEN OK button and use your own payment card to finish the test transaction.\nWhen successful, a receipt will be printed.

Tap or navigate to Refund by tapping on Refund on the screen or press 2 on the numeric pad.
To refund the last transaction tap on Last transaction or press 1. To refund an older transaction tap on By reference code or press 2.
Choose the transaction you want to refund
If By reference number has been selected, look for Ref. on the customer receipt and enter the 20 digits without the hyphen. Tap on Continue or press the GREEN OK button to continue.
Tap on Refund full amount to refund the full transaction amount or on Refund partial amount to enter a specific refund amount.
Select full or partial refund amount
Let your customer complete the refund by tapping (on top of the screen) or inserting a payment card.\nIn some cases, the terminal will ask for an application type or a pincode.

Place the terminal onto the base station. Press the bottom left Power button until the screen lights up. The terminal is ready when the “Enter amount” screen appears. This can take up to 1 min.

Type in a small amount and press the GREEN OK button to confirm.
Complete the test transaction by tapping (on top of the screen) or inserting your payment card.\nIn some cases, the terminal will ask for an application type or a pincode.
The terminal will print your own receipt.
Tap on Don’t print or the RED (X) button if your customer does not need the receipt or tap on Print or the GREEN (OK) button if they need it.

\"Nets MyPayments\" is now just \"MyPayments\"! We have renamed our app to cater to a larger audience in Europe. No actions required from you.

If your customer would like the receipt, click on the QR code symbol in the lower right corner. If not, click on the X.

Swipe to the left to access the overview of all the payment applications.
Open the app with the piggy bank symbol to receive tips.
Use the numeric pad to enter the amount of the transaction without the tip amount. Press the checkmark to confirm.
Your customer can use the numeric pad to type the desired tip amount or choose from the pre-set tip percentages at the bottom. Press the checkmark to confirm.
Let your customer add the desired tip amount
Let your customer complete the purchase by using their payment card.
Let your customer complete the purchase
The terminal will print your own receipt first.
Within 5 seconds, click on the X if your customer does not need the physical receipt or click the checkmark if they need it.
Decline or accept the printing of your customer’s receipt
This is the app with the cash register icon, which you use to take payments.
Handover the terminal to the customer and let them type the tip amount they would like. Then press the checkmark.
First enter original amount, then the tip amount and finally the combined amount
Swipe the card downwards with a quick move on the right side of the terminal. The card stripe should face the terminal.
Insert the card in the buttom of the terminal socket. The card can only be read when the chip is facing upwards.
Place the card less by the contactless area displayed on the terminal. When successful a green LED light will be shown.
In some cases a PIN code is required after the card interaction with the terminal.
Insert the amount that needs to be refunded and press the checkmark

The app can be found on the front page or by swiping through the apps.
A pop up box will appear with three options. Select the first option ‘Reverse transaction’.
Open the app with the cash register symbol to be able to reverse payments.
From the transaction history list, select the transaction you would like to reverse.
In the list of transactions, select the transaction you want to make a reversal of and press next.
If you haven’t reversed this transaction, three options will appear. You can choose to print your own or your customer’s receipt.

The terminal should be fully charged, but if not, leave in charging base for up to 6 hours.
To begin, present your iPhone to the customer and tap the payment card on the iPhone screen. This will flip the card to the customer view, allowing them to see the price of their purchase.
The terminal should be fully charged, but if not, leave in charging base for up to 6 hours.
Your customer holds their card or device horizontally at the top of your iPhone, over the contactless symbol.\nWhen you see the “done” checkmark, the transaction is complete.
In the transactions, you will be able to view and track your receipt. When you click on a transaction you’ll see the receipt details. In here you can share the receipts with your customers.

When you are done with a payment, the receipt will occur on your screen. The receipt will be shown and can be easily shared as the customer wish. Through e-mail, phone number or even WhatsApp or AirDrop.

Tap to Pay on iPhone uses the built-in features of iPhone to keep your business and your customer data private and secure. When a payment is processed, Apple does not store card numbers on the device or on Apple servers, so you can rest assured knowing your business stays yours.
Only for visa and master, giro and local schemes will not work

With Tap to Pay on iPhone and the MyPayments app, you can accept in-person contactless payments with only an iPhone — from physical debit and credit cards, to Apple Pay and other digital wallets — no extra terminals/readers or hardware needed. It’s easy, secure, and private.
Everything is already ready, but we have a small guide to tell you about the new features.
